column1: IF YOU HAVE FEEDBACK ON MIACME, PLEASE USE THE LIVE SPREADSHEET TO LEAVE COMMENTS, THANKS: http://tiny.cc/miacme-live

column6: Definition
column12: Example(s)

column1: An object that can exist independenty and can be identified uniquely.
column2: An ontology concept that annotates the corresponding entity.
column3: An attribute describing the corresponding entity.
column4: An ontology concept that annotates the corresponding property.
column5: The corresponding property should satisfy the specified condition (e.g. should be provided only if another property has a specific value).
column6: A statement of the exact meaning of the entity and/or property.
column7: The type of a property value.
column8: The recommended resources (e.g. ontology or database) that should be used to assigned the values for the corresponding Entity/Property pair.
column9: The expected number of occurrences for a particular property.
column10: Following RFC 2119 (http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2119.txt), a word indicating the level of necessity for a particular property.
column11: A reference to the document, article, schema, discussion that yields a particular entity or property necessary to be included and its requirement level.
column12: Typical cases for the values of a particular property.
column13: Additional comments that may help the interpretation and representation of the corresponding entity and/or property.

column6: A description of the study type or approach used, such as in vitro, in vivo, in silico.
column12: in vitro, in vivo, in silico

column6: A description of the cells used in the experiment.
column12: cell line, primary cell, patient-derived Xenograft,Organoid,Synthetic cell,etc

column6: The migration/invasion assay for this investigation, and its specifications.
column12:
single-cell migration, collective cell migration, developmental assay, 
immune response, chemotaxic, microfluidic, wound-healing, spheroid

column6: The manipulation/perturbation of which the (migratory) effect is being tested.
column8: ChEBI for compounds, PRO for specific proteins or targetted genes
column12: (RNAi, gene construct, chemicals, serum, substrate stiffness) or specific protein

column6: The nature or components of the material surrounding/contacting the cells for which migration is tested, including substrate, ECM protein or synthetic counterpart, tissue, other cells or entire organism.
column12: glass, plastic, ECM, gel collagen, fribronecting OR mouse, dermis, zebrafish, embryo

column6: The organism corresponding to the microEnvironment, if it is a tissue.

column5: if basicApproach=in vitro, it must be provided
column6: Solution used to provide nutritives and motility-assisting additives to migrating cells
column12: Epidermal Growth Factor (EGF) or motility assisted aditive (http://www.ebi.ac.uk/efo/EFO_0003298), Hepatocyte Growth Factor (HGF) (http://www.ebi.ac.uk/efo/EFO_0003303 ), DMEM (solution in definition: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0000918))
column13: This descriptor is only relevant for cells in some form of cell culture (in vitro or ex vivo, but not for in vivo)

column6: The type of cell being used in the study.
column12: cell line, primary cell, patient-derived cell, xenograft, organoid, synthetic cell

column6: The specific details about the cell.
column12: HT1080 (EFO:0002059),  neutrophil (CL:0000775)

column6: The organism of origin of the cell.
column12: Homo Sapiens

column6: The kind of assay.
The manner in which the cell population is presented at the start of the assay
column12: single cells, as a spheroid (a cell aggregate)  or as a confluent cell sheet,

column6: The nature of the perturbation/intervention/treatment being applied to the biological system.
column12: RNAi, gene construct, chemical compound, serum, substrate stiffness

column6: The set of values that the treatment will assume.
column12: if treatmentType="chemical compound", the values could be N-Formylmethionine Leucyl-Phenylalanine and Vehicle (control)

column6: The type of microscopy used to acquire images.
column8: Biological imaging methods (FBbi) or Chemical Methods Ontology (CHMO)
column12: confocal microscopy, spinning disk, wide-field, multi-photon, light-sheet, super-resolution, phase-contrast

column6: Single or multiple imaging timepoints in the experiment.
column12: endpoint or time-series

column6: For time-series, it is the timespan since the imaging process starts until it ends. For endpoint, it is the timespan since the starting point until the image is taken.
The unit of the observation period.
column12: hours, minutes

column6: The duration between two sequential frames of the time lapse series.
The unit of the time series interval.
column12: minutes

column6: Identification of the label or constrasts

Objective manufacturer and objective acronym specifying optical correction, primary use of microscopy method and magnification (may also include immersion medium and/or working distance or field of view)

Value that indicates the light acceptance angle of the objective (
determines the light gathering power, resolving power, and depth of 
field of the objective).
The physical dimension of one picture element in your image.
column13: for 3D tracking, it will be reconstructed

column6: The unit of the pixel size.
column12: µm

column6: The terms of use of the whole dataset associated with the study.
The set of raw images produced by the study.
The number of raw images.
The terms of use of the raw images.
The set of processed images produced by the study.
column12: filtered images, deconvoluted images, masked images, images with tracks overlay, traction flow, PIV flow fields

column6: The terms of use of the raw images.
The set of extracted features produced by the study.
column12: trajectories (x, y, t), derived quantities like cell speed, persistence of motion, shape features (cell area, cell solidity, cell perimeter…)

column6: The terms of use of the raw images.
A free text description of what was the curation process applied.
